node.statement:
PROMISING DIRECTION: INDUCTIVE APPROACH VIA DERIVATIVE IDENTITY

The MSS derivative identity r'(x) = n * (p^{(1)} boxplus_{n-1} q^{(1)})(x) is VERIFIED EXACTLY (error = 0 in all numerical tests). Here p^{(1)} = (1/n)*p' is the monic polynomial whose roots are the critical points of p.

This means the critical points of r are EXACTLY the roots of p^{(1)} boxplus_{n-1} q^{(1)}.

PROPOSED INDUCTIVE ARGUMENT:
Base case: n=2 is proved (equality holds).
Inductive step: Assume 1/Phi_{n-1}(s) >= 1/Phi_{n-1}(s_1) + 1/Phi_{n-1}(s_2) for all s = s_1 boxplus_{n-1} s_2. Show 1/Phi_n(r) >= 1/Phi_n(p) + 1/Phi_n(q) for r = p boxplus_n q.

OBSTACLE: The ratio Phi_n(p)/Phi_{n-1}(p^{(1)}) is NOT constant (varies from ~1.6 to ~6 depending on the root configuration). Therefore, a simple "multiply both sides by the same constant" argument fails.

HOWEVER: The inequality ineq_n = 1/Phi_n(r) - 1/Phi_n(p) - 1/Phi_n(q) is always positive when ineq_{n-1} is positive (verified in all 20 test cases). The magnitudes are comparable, suggesting a possible relationship.

WHAT IS NEEDED: A formula or inequality relating Phi_n(p) to Phi_{n-1}(p^{(1)}) and the interlacing structure. If we could show:
  Phi_n(p) <= f(Phi_{n-1}(p^{(1)}), root gaps)
for some function f that respects the inductive hypothesis, the proof could close.

ALTERNATIVE: Instead of induction on n, use the derivative identity to relate the subordination functions at degree n to those at degree n-1, inheriting the structural properties (like <h,alpha> >= 0).
